title: Sidewall, "The Redmond", 1930–40
description: Design composed of two genre scenes. One is of a lady dressed in the Directoire period walking in a park. There is an urn on a pedestal at right and an iron fence in rear. The other scene is a man also dress in Directoire fashion walking in a park with an iron fence and gate in the rear. Back- ground is covered with an orderly arrangement of cloth. Scenes enclosed in octagonal frame of laurel leaf shaft border. Smaller rectangular insets arebetween with a nosegay of flowers as a motif. The field is covered with fine parallel horizontal lines. This paper is often referred to as the "High Hat". The original was used as a covering on a child's trunk found inVersailles. "Thomas Strahan" printed on margin. Printed in blue, mauve and gray on tan field.
